website_summaries.verdict: This basic jump trainer is great for beginners and works for a variety of heights.
pros: This jump trainer has comfortable ankle straps and durable rubber resistance bands that are easy to adjust on the belt to target different muscle groups
Built-in shoe harness keeps straps in place
Customers find that this jump trainer works for a wide range of heights
cons: Many customers found the belt uncomfortable on the waist

customer_reviews.title: and i seen a review saying it isn't for guys over 5'11 or something like that, but it works well for me
customer_reviews.text: At first I didn't think it was much at all, but then i started doing the workouts. It added a lot of resistance and it works well. I'm 6'6, and i seen a review saying it isn't for guys over 5'11 or something like that, but it works well for me. I worked out for about 30 minutes with them and when i took them off, it felt like my legs were extra bouncy lol. Anyways, it seems to work, I'll leave another review after a few months
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Amen
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing a lot but if you are wearing leggings make sure you don’t care about the leggings or they are worn out because the attachment to the ankle wears out the thread near your ankles but if u aren’t wearing leggings your great. I love this because after wearing this my legs burn which is great I feels a bit weird to walk at first but you get used to it it’s great for everything
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth N.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this product for my son to help improve ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my son to help improve his vertical jump for basketball. It has helped him get more rebounds
customer_reviews.author: kkn07

customer_reviews.title: Best if under 6 foot tall
customer_reviews.text: Works okay. Need to wear long socks to prevent skin irritation. Best if under 6 foot tall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its fine....I guess
customer_reviews.text: Product is ok overall. The waistband doesn't stay up and the ankle support straps come off every so often. It does help increase overall leg strength and helps with back posture.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay!
customer_reviews.text: The old version was much better. Not much tension with either bands and I’m 5’10”.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Made for larger people I’m 5-6 and medium build this works for people much taller. Had to return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: missing resistance bands
customer_reviews.text: we received an open package and the resistance bands arent inside anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Janna

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhhh
customer_reviews.text: Hurts my knees & very uncomfortable. That could just be for me though, I heard other people like it. Try for yourself
customer_reviews.author: Shammond Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Simple to attach to the athlete
customer_reviews.text: I use it for track and field( Long Jump agility)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My son is almost 12 and 5'3". He does a few jumps each day and he says its really helping him. He only does about 15-20 each day because it leaves him a little sore. Not too much but enough to feel it working. Moderation and with stretching beforehand to avoid any injuries. He loves it! We recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Not much resistance. Suitable for beginners only. There's ...
customer_reviews.text: Not much resistance. Suitable for beginners only. There's also no way to buy higher resistance cables since Sklz don't make them.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Terrible from what I can tell.
customer_reviews.text: I had another set from a different company that I would much rather have. I don't like the lock and unlock feature. I don't like that I can't get stronger bands. I've gotten too strong for these resistance bands and have no way to go to another level of resistance. There are only 2 options and it annoys me, so I no longer use them. If there is a higher resistance band, I have been UNABLE to find it so I can order it. It could just be me, but I doubt it as I googled everything I could think to google to find something more challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A Glenon

customer_reviews.title: Love them, I used them for squat
customer_reviews.text: Love them, I used them for squat, lunges and to work on my vertical jump. Yes they look weird to use them in a gym but who cares, they serve the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amira Elshandidi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Quality, still dont know if it really help improve vertical jump.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Very very good. Little uncomfortable at first, but not too bad
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE. They were a little difficult to figure out at first, but once you get them on, you're set! They even come with suggested workouts! I'm a 5'8" volleyball player, and the resistance is just right! The ankle pads are just a bit uncomfortable, but high socks are an easy fix! I've only been using them for a few days, so no huge difference in my vertical yet, but there definitely will be by the time volleyball season comes around.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a loyal skilz customer bought ladders from them etc. I just ordered this vertical jump trainer last Friday and just opened it and both resistance bands were missing!!!!!!!!!!! The plan was to use it for my last practice tomorrow but I can't because skilz screwed up! Returning the item and getting my money back and never buying a skilz item again. Comon
customer_reviews.author: Little John

customer_reviews.title: Be better than competition
customer_reviews.text: I am a Stunt Performer for major tv shows and movies, and this help me stay in shape and ahead off the game
customer_reviews.author: matt shadden

customer_reviews.title: Improves  your legs
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, improves your strength and resistance on you legs, it has 2 pairs resistance cables. I used in my training and it's just amazing
customer_reviews.author: Cata

customer_reviews.title: The belt seems pretty tight but ill be using the adidas jump trainer ...
customer_reviews.text: One band seems really short and if you put two bands together the joining pieces look clunky and it could rub on the back of your legs. Maybe i need to try it out again with the one band, but on initial try on it did not work well. The belt seems pretty tight but ill be using the adidas jump trainer bands with this belt and see how it goes. Overall, was not satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Targeted Workouts and General Workouts
customer_reviews.text: The SKLZ HOPZ is a great workout device. Definitely useful for folks looking to get more vertical jumping ability and explosiveness. Just as good for those like me that use it for at home work outs. Great for HIIT. The belt can and does tend to bite in to the hips a bit. I have tried stuffing towels in to the area that hurt and that helps a bit. With a lot of these resistance band products I am always a bit concerned about durability of the bands themselves but also the clasps that hold them. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: jt

customer_reviews.title: Works with some discomfort
customer_reviews.text: This works well as it definitely adds resistance and strengthens your legs, however, like many others have stated, it is incredibly uncomfortable. The two smaller cuffs attach to your legs and have no problems. The second part of this device is a belt that you wear above your waist. You connect the cuffs and the belt with tension bands to add vertical resistance to your jumps. Because the belt is above your waist and the tension bands are below it, the belt tries to move down during exercise. This makes the belt cut down into your hips.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. E

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but not too comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trainer for helping to improve jumping skills, whether they be for basketball or another sport, or just wanting to improve. However, when my son and I tried it out, we also found it to be uncomfortable like another reviewer had mentioned. So with that, I don't absolutely love it, but it does work the way it was intended, just don't expect it to be comfortable. Overall, it's a good product, and I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lola Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept - Uncomfortable Design
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of a targeted exercise device aimed at increasing your vertical acceleration or jumping. Overall the HOPZ is well designed and thought our however the waistband is very uncomfortable which, as an anchor to the system, makes the usability of this less than stellar. With a more comfortable design this would be a 5 Star for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great workout for legs, but not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: If you play basketball, this is an excellent piece of equipment to help you improve your jumping skills for a slam dunk. If you're not into basketball, it is still a great piece of equipment for people who want to work out and improve the muscle tone and strength in their legs. It comes with two resistance cables for two different tensions. It does work your legs very well, however, the belt that goes around your waist can be very uncomfortable, especially to someone with a pain condition. Otherwise, it definitely does what it says it will.
customer_reviews.author: Raed Haed

customer_reviews.title: took me a good 30 minutes to set up
customer_reviews.text: It was complicated to set up at first, took me a good 30 minutes to set up. But once it was set up it worked great i can definitely tell the difference from when i was previously jumping (for Parkour) and now.
customer_reviews.author: LynnB

customer_reviews.title: Looks good for slightly larger sized people
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter for volleyball training. She's an XS-S in most clothes, and she's unable to tighten it down enough in the waist to make it work for her. The product looks to be well made, but she couldn't even try it.
customer_reviews.author: Mmm

product_meta.title: SKLZ HOPZ Straps Vertical Jump Trainer with Belt, Cuffs, and Resistance Bands
product_meta.description: With a new, adjustable belt and patented Slide-Lock technology, HOPZ increases explosive leg power and strengthens muscles for higher vertical jump.
feature_bullets: Strap on to build explosive leg power and strengthen jumping muscles
Move resistance cables on belt to target specific muscles
Change resistance cable quickly with patented Slide-Lock on belt and ankle straps
Adjustable belt with side padding fits better and helps with proper cable placement
Durable cables and ankle straps with built-in shoe harness keeps straps in place
